attributes.comment:
I just read about the proposed fee increases for immigration services. I find
that this is a terrible abuse of a government agency's authority. We claim to
be a welcoming nation. We claim also that we want people to abide by the rules
when immigrating to the United States. Yet someone wants to make sure that
neither of these things are actually true. By raising the fees the message is
being sent that the doors are closing. If people want to come here they are
going to have to do desperate things. Isn't the situation desperate enough already?

I also have a further concern, namely the thousands of intercountry adoptive
families that form and expand each year. Having read this proposal, it sounds
very much as if the Department of Homeland Security is going to fund its other
missions by saddling adoptive families with additional costs. How many families
will remain incomplete, how many children will continue to languish in
orphanages, all because this massive fee increase is the straw that breaks the
camel's back? Worse, this applies also to children who have arrived home,
apparently, as there is also a proposed increase for the Certificate of
Citizenship. Federal law CLEARLY states that adopted children are citizens as
soon as their adoptions are finalized. The Department of Homeland Security is
already taking terrible advantage of adoptive families by charging a fee for a
document to which families already have the right. Raising this fee only
exacerbates the problem.

Finally, what about those people who marry overseas legitimately, or those
immigrant families who are already here legally and have valid reasons for
wanting to bring family members here as well? Are they too going to be subject
to these massively unfair provisions?

In short, those who have proposed such a radical increase should be ashamed of
themselves. A moderate increase would be bad enough, but perhaps
understandable. The size of the proposed increase is unconscionable and needs
to be adjusted now.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Laura Dennis-Bay
